io.launchowl.viewvalidationlibrary

Interface Criteria.AsyncCondition<T extends android.view.View>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of View being evaluated
    Enclosing class:
    Criteria<T extends android.view.View>

    public static interface Criteria.AsyncCondition<T extends android.view.View>
    An asynchronous condition is a single test that performs an asynchronous operation and then returns a true or false value to the supplied Criteria.AsyncConditionCompletionListener.

    Conditions are intended to test a single event. Add additional conditions to a Criteria instance to test each unique event.

    For example, one condition could test whether a username contains valid characters. A separate condition could test whether the username contains profanity.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void evaluate(Criteria.AsyncConditionCompletionListener asyncConditionCompletionListener, T view)
      Perform an asynchronous test using information from the view being evaluated.
